bibl.title: Leonard Martin v. Washington Territory. Return
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Territory of Washington Third Judicial District County of King } ss.
In the District Court holding terms at Seattle.
In the matter of the Application of Leonard Martin for a Writ of Habeas Corpus } No. 4432 Return
To Hon. Roger S. Greene, Judge of the above entitled District Court:

Come now John H. McGraw, Sheriff of King County, Washington Territory, to whom the writ of Habeas Corpus in this cause is directed, and make retun theron, and shows to the Court:That he is the Sheriff of King county, as aforesaid, and ex-office to keep of the jail of said County and that the petitioner for a writ of habeas corpus, Leonard Martin, is in the custody of Jesse W. George, United States Marshal for Wahington Territory, and was by said Jesse W. Gorge on the 7th day of May, 1885, place in said jail for safe keeping; and that said petitioner is not now, and never was in the custody of this repondent, except by his being placed in the jail of which this repondent is keeper as aforesaid.

And now comes also Jesse W. George, United States, Marshall for Washington Territory and Makes further return a jon the pregoing annexed writ and in obedience thereto things into Court before your Honor the body of the said Leonat Martin, and shows to the Cours as to the time and cause of the detention of him the said Leonard Martin That on the firt day of May 1885 at Port Townsend in Jefferson County Washington said Petitioner was accused before J. G. Swan, a United States Commissioner, on oath by one J.G. Clinger, of the Crime of selling of isituous liquors to an indian under charge of an indian agent of the United States, and was there and there by said United States Commissioner held to answer for said crime, and ordered to enter in to recongizance with Suretis in the sum of one hundred dollard for his appearance before the District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory holding Terms at Post Townsend at the nect regular term ther of a answer the charge made agaisnt him as aforsaid and in default of such heid said petitioner was by said United States Commissioner on said
first day of May 1885, Committed to te Custody of this respondents to be Reft and broug his before said District Court, and a of Commitment under the hand and seal of said United States Commissioner was therefor issued to me, which warrant is herto annexed and made a part of this retun, and I now hold said petitioner inmy Custody by virtue of said Warrant and not otherwise.
In witness whereof I have herto set my hand at my office in said district this first day of May AD 1885
James G Swan US Commissioner 3rd Judicial Dist WT
I certify the above and to be a there confy of this original commitment in the case of United States vs Martin changed with selling wiskey to Indians made by me this first day, of May AD 1885
James G Swan US Commissioner 3rd Judicial Dist WT
USCommision Court James G Swon Commission The United States vs Leonard Martin} Selling Whiskey to Indians
Certified of Comitmend Issued May 1st 1885 Retun & filed
